results.abstract: The screening rooms were closed. The festivals were virtual. The blockbusters were in storage. Even so, our critics found abundant and inspiring signs of cinematic life in the pandemic.

results.abstract: Gary Oldman plays a Hollywood hack with an ax to grind in David Fincher’s reinterpretation of the legend of “Citizen Kane.”
results.title: ‘Mank’ Review: A Rosebud by Any Other Name

results.abstract: Kemp Powers is the co-director of “Soul” and screenwriter of “One Night in Miami,” but his collaborators may not know just how much of himself is in those films.

results.title: How Francis Ford Coppola Got Pulled Back In to Make ‘The Godfather, Coda’
Elliot Page, Oscar-Nominated ‘Juno’ Star, Announces He Is Transgender
results.abstract: “Hi friends, I want to share with you that I am trans, my pronouns are he/they and my name is Elliot,” Page wrote in a statement that he posted on Tuesday.

multimedia.caption: “My joy is real, but it is also fragile,” Elliot Page wrote in a statement announcing he is transgender.
“My joy is real, but it is also fragile,” Elliot Page wrote in a statement announcing he is transgender.

Amanda Seyfried Finally Stakes Her Claim
results.abstract: The “Mean Girls” and “Mamma Mia!” actress knows her performance as Marion Davies in“Mank” will be a turning point in her career. But first, she had to put some distance between herself and Hollywood.

Actors Sue SAG-AFTRA Health Plan Over Changes in Insurance
results.abstract: Ed Asner, a seven-time Emmy winner, is the lead plaintiff in the lawsuit filed in Los Angeles on Tuesday; it includes nine other participants.

multimedia.caption: Ed Asner, who is 91, would  lose coverage when SAG-AFTRA Health Plan changes take effect in 2021 because he will not reach a new earnings threshold, the lawsuit says.

HBO Documentary Has Competition. These Women Don’t Seem Worried.
results.abstract: These days everybody wants a piece of the nonfiction game. HBO’s documentary heads, Nancy Abraham and Lisa Heller, talked about how they’re navigating the evolving landscape.

multimedia.caption: Lisa Heller, left, and Nancy Abraham took over HBO’s documentary department in 2018 amid seismic changes in how documentaries are made, distributed and watched.

results.abstract: Set in the present day, this adaptation of the classic children’s novel forgets why the story of a horse surviving the maliciousness of humans has endured for so long.
